questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 1: A particle moves along the x-axis such that its position as a function of time is given by x(t) = 4t³ - 6t² + 3t - 5, where x is in meters and t is in seconds. The acceleration of the particle at t = 2 s is:

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 2: Which of the following statements is/are correct about simple harmonic motion?
options: Option 1: The acceleration is proportional to displacement
Option 2: The total energy remains constant
Option 3: The velocity is maximum at the mean position
Option 4: The acceleration is maximum at the extreme positions
